jjil.core
Class Error

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      jjil.core.Error
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Error
public class Error
extends java.lang.Throwable

Error defines a common error-reporting mechanism for all JJIL classes. It includes an error code and up to three string objects representing objects that explain the error, for example file names or images.

Author:
webb
See Also:
Serialized Form

Error

public Error(int nPackage,
             int nCode,
             java.lang.String szParam1,
             java.lang.String szParam2,
             java.lang.String szParam3)
This is how Error objects are created. The first two parameters determine the specific type of error. The other parameters give information about the objects causing the error.

Parameters:
nPackage - package where error code is defined.
nCode - : the error code
szParam1 - : a first parameter giving detailed information
szParam2 - : a second parameter giving detailed information
szParam3 - : a third parameter giving detailed information
